title: Can I claim the $175,000 California homestead exemption in bankruptcy?
question: I have unsecured debt and am considering bankruptcy,but need to know the answer to one question before proceeding:.
answers:
Yes, the part about "involuntary sale" means that creditors are seeking to force a sale of your house, in which case the proceeds would be exempt for up to 6 months after the sale.

There's more to look into because it isn't clear how a judge will calculate "gross annual income:" for example, in one case a debtor over the age of 55 normally earned more than the statutory limit at that time but claimed investment losses which brought his income on the tax return below the limit to claim the enhanced exemption.

(The court found that the debtor should not be allowed to claim the losses for purposes of this question and denied the enhancement; the debtor was entitled only to the lower exemption amount.)
